availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Crabb (Warren County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer.)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah W. Johnson Crabb in Warren County, Kentucky, on February 12, 1846. Father of Esther Crabb. Married to Louisa A. Johnson Crabb in Warren County, Kentucky, on June 1, 1851. Father of Agatha Crabb, Robert O. Crabb, and William Crabb. Merchant in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860, including Mary [Unknown].

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 60A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 130.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Covington Precinct, p. 116B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994057, Warren County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000339890.
"William H. Crabb (1810-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial 11592677, accessed July 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11592677.
